meanings.definition: The ability of certain organisms to produce their own food using inorganic compounds as a source of energy.
meanings.sent1: Chemoautotrophies are important for some organisms to make their own food.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study chemoautotrophies to understand how organisms survive.
meanings.sent3: The chemoautotrophies of the tiny bacteria amazed the curious students.
meanings.sent4: In the depths of the ocean, chemoautotrophies work like tiny factories.
meanings.sent5: The concept of chemoautotrophies fascinated the young biologist.

meanings.definition: The process by which certain bacteria and archaea obtain energy by oxidizing inorganic substances.
meanings.sent1: Chemoautotrophies help bacteria and archaea get energy from inorganic substances.
meanings.sent2: The chemoautotrophies of these microorganisms are crucial for their survival.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria's chemoautotrophies seemed like a magical energy source.
meanings.sent4: In the world of microorganisms, chemoautotrophies are like power plants.
meanings.sent5: The unique chemoautotrophies of these organisms puzzled the researchers.
